intro: Amsinckia paludosa, commonly known as the marsh tarplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and its ability to thrive in wet or moist environments. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, which are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It is often found in marshes, wet meadows, and along the edges of ponds. Amsinckia paludosa is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
